task.summary: Default task
Created main method and accessed direction from starting room
Added a method that can read the user input that is a direction and return the description of the room they are in
Added a scanner to take user input on which direction to go. Then added a getRoomDescriptionBasedOnDirection method that gets the description of the room that is in the direction the user inputs.
fixed the getRoomDescriptionBasedOnDirection method to return the current room's description if the user inputs a direction that is not valid

Added a while loop in my main method so it can repeat asking for the user input. Added a printRoomDirectionsBasedOnInput method that prints the directions the person can go based on the room they are in. Fixed my printRoomDescriptionBasedOnDirection by printing the right description of a room based on the user inputted direction. Also fixed by indicateHavingReachedEnd method to return a boolean based on if the user's inputted direction points them to the ending room, and if so it exits the game.
Commented my methods in the Adventures class
If the user's inputted direction does not match any of the directions possible it prints "I can't go " and the user's inputted direction. This is done through invalidInput method in Adventure class.
Added a not valid direction method that prints out either it cannot go a certain invalid direction or it does not understand the user's input which is not even a valid input.
Prints the current room's description even if the user types an invalid input
When the user inputs an invalid direction or inputs a command that is not even a direction it prints out the correct response and their current room description.
Added the main method to print out "You have reached the final destination" when the user reaches the ending room
If the user inputted only one word direction such as "east" it should print it does not understand what that is and allow them to retype a valid input.
Fixed invalid inputs method to check if the user inputted a direction that didn't match any of the other directions possible then it printed the CORRECT output which is "I cant go 'some direction'"
Wrote test cases for the method setCurrentRoomObject in adventures class
Wrote more test cases for invalid inputs that the user can possibly input to try and break my code, and fixed this method in Adventure class when it did break my code by updating my tracker variable.
Wrote test cases to try and break my printDescriptionBasedOnDirection method in the Adventure class by checking edge cases(starting and ending rooms) as well as a random room

Wrote test cases to try and break my printPossibleDirectionsBasedOnInput method in the Adventure class by checking random rooms and if the output had more than one direction I ensured it printed all of those direction.
Wrote test cases for the indicateHavingReachedEnd method that returned true if the user reached the end of the game and false if they did not reach the end of the game.

Wrote more test cases to try and break my checkIfInputIsAValidDirection method to see if it returns true if user inputs a valid input and see if it returns false when user inputs only the direction name.

Added a try catch to my parsingJson method to gracefully detect and handle the case where user provided a bad URL. Also allowed users to specify an alternate URL on the command line in my main method.
Added some more test cases like null and valid inputs to try and break my code, then cleaned my formatting and method names and made sure to meet all the assignment requirements.
Cleaned my formatting and method names and made sure to meet all the assignment requirements.
Cleaned my formatting again in test class.
Based on feedback, I added vertical space to fix layout, changed my variable toReturn to directionsFromInput to make it a noun, and added helper methods to have a better design as reccommended.
Wrote my Development.md.
Wrote my Development.md.
Wrote my own JSON file of Disney World.
Updated Development.md file
Made the game work with my JSON.

Displayd which items are in a room and allowed a player to pick the item they want. Then based on this input I printed the directions a player can go from this room using my player class. Did this by altering my helper methods and adding a setItems method in the player class.
Accessed enabler and validkey names to continue the game by creating a enableDirectionBasedOnInput method.
Fixed enabler method to correctly output when a user picks up an item that can take them to the next place.
Fixed a bug in the enable method to accurately print the right description when the user inputs.
Allowed the user to know when the game reached the end, and also added the game extension which involves fighting a monster(Ursula) and defeating her by answering 5 questions correctly.
Fixed game extension so that it loops until user types in the correct answers to finish the game.
Cleaned up helper methods and fixed runGame method to have proper output when user types an invalid input.
Added another game extension: teleportation. By adding the teleportPlayer method I can teleport a player to the end room if they answer a question right on the first try, if not the game continues.
Edited Development.md file.
Wrote test cases for startGame method.
Wrote test cases for startGame method.
Wrote test cases for null and invalid inputs for helper methods to try and break code.
Extended my game so that it can take a URL and load the JSON from that and this is done as an argument on the command line.
Wrote test cases for checking if I parsed my JSON properly.
Wrote more test cases for my helper method to test if I print the next room description and possible directions properly to try and break my code.
Wrote test cases for indicating when the game has reached an end and test cases for good and bad URLs. Through this I broke my urlRunner method but then fixed it.
Wrote test cases for enabler method to try and break my enabler method.
Wrote test cases for my teleporting method part of the game extension.
Wrote test cases for the method where I fight ursula.
Added my monster extension to my Json and created a Monster and Questions class to allow the player to fight this monster.
